content.user_title: Build Self-Learning AI Agents with ReasoningBank
content.value_statement: AI agents waste time repeating the same suboptimal approaches. ReasoningBank enables agents to learn from experience, recognize patterns, and continuously improve their strategies over time.
actual_capabilities: Records and learns from task experiences and outcomes
Recommends optimal strategies based on past performance
Recognizes patterns in agent behavior and results
Enables transfer learning between similar tasks
Provides meta-learning for learning about learning
limitations: Needs 100+ experiences per task type for quality recommendations
Learning effectiveness depends on quality of recorded context

output: - Check prop types and state management
Based on 127 similar reviews with 94% success rate

best_practices: Record both successes and failures to build balanced learning data
Include rich context like environment, constraints, and relevant metadata
Set confidence thresholds to filter low-quality learnings
anti_patterns: Only recording successful outcomes creates biased learning
Storing experiences without context reduces pattern matching accuracy
Never learning from failures misses valuable optimization opportunities

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, ReasoningBank works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex through the agentic-flow framework.

faq.question: How much data is needed before recommendations improve?
faq.answer: You need at least 100 experiences per task type for quality recommendations, with performance improving as you add more data.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing agent system?
faq.answer: Yes, ReasoningBank integrates through simple API calls and works with any agent architecture using agentic-flow.

faq.question: Is my learning data secure?
faq.answer: Data is stored locally in AgentDB by default. You control persistence settings and can encrypt sensitive information.

faq.question: What if recommendations are poor quality?
faq.answer: Ensure you have sufficient training data and rich context. Enable vector search for better pattern matching.

faq.question: How does this compare to simple logging?
faq.answer: Unlike logging, ReasoningBank actively learns patterns and recommends strategies based on accumulated experience.
